SLAB EDGE DETAIL, TYPICAL
SCALE: 1/2" = 1'-0"
images.summary: This detail shows a typical slab edge for a foundation with a single-storey wood-framed structure above, identified as W1. The slab consists of 6" poured concrete with 6x6x6/6 welded wire mesh (W.W.M.) centered in the slab. The edge is reinforced with 4-15M continuous rebar. A 6 mil poly vapour barrier and 2" rigid insulation with a minimum of 30 PSI are included for moisture and thermal protection. The base consists of compacted granular 'A' or 3/4" stone, with a minimum thickness of 6". Anchor bolts are specified at 48" on center for securing the PT 2x6 sill plate. The detail is referenced as 3/S2 and is drawn at a scale of 1/2" = 1'-0".

images.summary: This plan shows the layout of the floating slab foundation for the farm building. The slab dimensions are 100'-0" by 46'-6" with additional sections measuring 12'-6" and 28'-6". The slab includes (2) 15M continuous rebar at the bottom of thickened floor beams and is designed to slope to drain at 1% over 10'-0". Floor drains are detailed in 3/S3 and are to be connected to a water/oil separator as needed. The concrete floor is specified as 6" thick with a compressive strength of 32 MPa, reinforced with 6x6x6 W.W.M. at mid-depth. The base consists of compacted granular fill with a minimum thickness of 6". Insulation under the slab is optional. The plan is referenced as 3/S2 and 2/S3, drawn at a scale of 1" = 10'-0".

images.text_verbatim:
GENERAL NOTES:
FOUNDATIONS:
1. PREPARE THE AREA FOR THE PROPOSED STRUCTURE BY REMOVING ALL TOPSOIL & ORGANIC MATERIAL FROM THE AREA OF THE BUILDING.
2. SUBGRADE SHALL BE SUITABLE FOR 1500 P.S.F (75 kPA) SAFE BEARING AND NOT HIGHLY FROST SUSCEPTIBLE.
3. PROVIDE INSULATION PER CANADIAN FOUNDATION ENGINEERING MANUAL. UNDER SLAB INSULATION: IF NOT INSTALLED, CLIENT / CONTRACTOR ACCEPTS THE POTENTIAL OF CRACKING / HEAVING OVER TIME (IF BUILDING IS NOT HEATED) OR HEAT LOSS (IF BUILDING IS HEATED) PERIMETER INSULATION: IF NOT INSTALLED, CLIENT / CONTRACTOR ACCEPTS THE POTENTIAL OF CRACKING / HEAVING OVER TIME.
CONCRETE:
1. ALL CONCRETE SHALL HAVE A MINIMUM OF 28 DAYS OF COMPRESSIVE STRENGTH OF 32 MPa C/W 6% AIR ENTRAINMENT AND WATER / CEMENT RATIO OF 0.45 MAX.
2. ALL REINFORCEMENT IS TO BE GRADE 400 MPa.
3. REBAR SPLICE LENGTH: 15M BARS, 18" LAP; WELDED WIRE MESH (WWM), 9" LAP
4. ALL CONCRETE WORK SHALL BE CARRIED OUT IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE LATEST EDITION OF THE NATIONAL BUILDING CODE, CAN/CSA-A23.1/A23.2-M90 AND LOCAL BY-LAWS.
5. CONCRETE COVER SHALL BE AS FOLLOWS:
a) 3" WHERE CONCRETE IS IN CONTACT WITH EARTH (I.E. FOOTINGS)
b) 2" WHERE IN FORMS OF WEATHER OR EARTH (SIDE OF FLOATING SLABS)
6. BEAR SLAB ON MIN. 6" OF GRANULAR 'A' FILL (COMPACTED TO 98% SPPD) IN 6" LIFTS AT A TIME.
7. SLOPE SLAB TO A DEPTH OF 1/4 SLOPE DRAINS (1 1/2").
images.summary: The general notes provide essential guidelines for the foundation and concrete work of the farm building. Foundation preparation requires the removal of all topsoil and organic material, with a subgrade suitable for 1500 P.S.F (75 kPA) safe bearing. Insulation is recommended per the Canadian Foundation Engineering Manual, with potential risks of cracking or heat loss if not installed. Concrete specifications include a minimum compressive strength of 32 MPa with 6% air entrainment and a maximum water/cement ratio of 0.45. Reinforcement must be Grade 400 MPa, with specific rebar splice lengths for 15M bars and welded wire mesh. Concrete work must comply with the National Building Code and local by-laws. Concrete cover requirements are detailed for different conditions, and the slab must bear on a minimum of 6" of compacted granular 'A' fill. The slab should be sloped to a depth of 1/4 slope drains (1 1/2").

A 6 mil poly vapour barrier is placed below the concrete, followed by 2 inches of rigid insulation with a minimum compressive strength of 30 PSI. The detail is referenced as 3/S3, indicating its location in the drawing set.

images.summary: This roof plan outlines the arrangement of pre-engineered farm trusses set at 4'-8" on center, directly above the studs. The plan includes lateral bracing with continuous 2x6 "X" braces fastened to the top of the bottom chord. The bottom chords of the gable truss are fastened to the top wall plate with three 10d nails at 19 inches on center, typical at both ends. The plan is referenced as 1/S4 and is scaled at 1 inch equals 10 feet. The plan ensures proper structural stability and connection between the roof and supporting walls.

SCALE: 1/8" = 1'-0"

ANCHOR 2x4 DIAGONAL 'X' ON OPPOSITE SIDE OF WEB WITHIN TWO OF 3 1/2" NAILS @ EACH TRUSS
ANCHOR 2x4 DIAGONAL BRACE TO LATERAL WITH FOUR OF 3 1/2" NAILS @ INTERSECTION OF TRUSS WEB & TRUSS LATERAL
BUTT 2x4 LATERALS @ ALL SPLICE LOCATIONS. ENSURE BUTT JOINT IS TIGHT & CENTERED ON TRUSS WEB.
LAP 2x4 DIAGONAL (Min. 2 TRUSSES) TO ENSURE DIAGONAL BRACE EXTENDS COMPLETELY FROM TOP CHORD OF TRUSS TO BOTTOM CHORD OF TRUSS. (AS REQUIRED)
ANCHOR DIAGONAL BRACE TO STRUT @ BOTH ENDS WITH FOUR 3 1/2" NAILS

TRUSS BOTTOM CHORD
TRUSS WEB MEMBER
images.summary: This detail illustrates the lateral 'X' brace system for trusses, providing structural stability. The drawing specifies the use of 2x4 struts, each 5'-0" long, secured with 3 1/2" nails at each truss web member. The spacing is determined by the brace designer, with a maximum of 48'-0". Diagonal braces are anchored to the lateral with four 3 1/2" nails at the intersection of the truss web and lateral. The diagram emphasizes the importance of tight butt joints centered on the truss web. The diagonal braces must extend from the top chord to the bottom chord of the truss, ensuring comprehensive support. This detail is referenced as 2/S5.

images.summary: This section view provides a longitudinal cut through the farm building, highlighting the structural relationship between the roof, walls, and foundation. The roof features a 4/12 pitch with metal cladding, 2x4 strapping at 24" o.c., and pre-engineered trusses at 48" o.c. Truss uplift clips are installed as per manufacturer drawings. The section specifies a floating slab foundation with a typical sill assembly using 1/2" diameter anchor bolts at 48" o.c. The drawing references detail 2/S5 for 'X' bracing of truss laterals. The section is identified as 1/S5.

images.text_verbatim:
NOTES FOR BRACING OF ROOF TRUSS(ES):
1 -- >> CONTRACTOR AND OR OWNER TO NOTIFY MANUFACTURER OF ANY TRUSS DEFICIENCIES SUCH AS DAMAGED OR BROKEN TRUSSES, WARPING OF TRUSS MEMBERS, AND MISSING OR OFFSET TRUSS PLATES.
2 -- >> DIAGONAL BRACING MUST BE PROVIDED ON ALL WEB MEMBERS THAT REQUIRE LATERAL BRACING. DIAGONAL BRACING SHALL BE SPACED AS NOTED ON THE ATTACHED DRAWING(S). & X-BRACING SHALL BE PROVIDED @ ENDWALLS @ INTERVALS NOTED ON THE ROOF PLAN.
3 -- >> PERMANENT LATERAL BRACING TO BE INSTALLED ON WEB MEMBERS AS INDICATED ON THE ROOF PLAN AND MANUFACTURERS DRAWINGS.
4 -- >> PROVIDE DIAGONAL BRACING @ ALL DISCONTINUITIES IN LATERAL BRACING SUCH AS WHERE TRUSS TYPE CHANGES
5 -- >> THE TRUSS SUPPLIER SHALL DESIGN THE TRUSSES FOR THE BRACING NOTED. BRACING DETAILS WILL NOT BE MODIFIED UNLESS SPECIFIED BY THE BUILDING DESIGNER.
images.summary: These notes provide guidelines for the bracing of roof trusses. Contractors or owners must notify manufacturers of any truss deficiencies, including damage or warping. Diagonal bracing is required on all web members needing lateral support, with spacing as specified in the drawings. X-bracing is to be installed at endwalls at intervals noted on the roof plan. Permanent lateral bracing must be installed as indicated in the roof plan and manufacturer drawings. Diagonal bracing should be provided at all discontinuities in lateral bracing. The truss supplier is responsible for designing the trusses for the specified bracing.

Anchor bolts are placed at 48" o.c., with a 5" x 3" x 1/4" angle and 5/8" anchor bolt or equivalent epoxy anchor embedded 8" into concrete at each end of the shearwall. The detail is referenced as 3/S6.

7/16" OSB ON ONE SIDE FASTENED w/ 2 3/8" NAIL-GUN NAILS @ 4" o.c. PANEL EDGES AND 8" o.c. IN FIELD. PROVIDE BLOCKING @ 24" o.c. AND ALL PANEL EDGES. (3) PLY STUD POST EACH END OF SHEARWALL SEE DETAIL 3/S6
images.summary: This note specifies the construction details for a shearwall. The shearwall is constructed with 7/16" OSB on one side, fastened using 2 3/8" nail-gun nails. The nails are spaced at 4 inches on center (o.c.) along the panel edges and 8 inches o.c. in the field. Blocking is required at 24 inches o.c. and along all panel edges. Each end of the shearwall includes a three-ply stud post. The note references detail 3/S6 for further information. These specifications ensure the shearwall's structural integrity and compliance with design standards.
